Reference Text: <S sid="39" ssid="5">Additionally, PLTM assumes that each “topic” consists of a set of discrete distributions over words—one for each language l = 1, ... , L. In other words, rather than using a single set of topics Φ = {φ1, ... , φT}, as in LDA, there are L sets of language-specific topics, Φ1, ... , ΦL, each of which is drawn from a language-specific symmetric Dirichlet with concentration parameter βl.</S>
